--- Derek James <blue5432@...> wrote:
<snip>
> What I was describing wouldn't build in any
> particular
> strategy.  It would simply mean that the input to
> the
> ANN would be two board positions each turn, rather
> than all of the board positions. 
> 
> To keep inputting 000 for every empty space every
> turn
> is an inefficiency (albeit a small one with only a
> six-card game...but when the number of cards is
> increased, efficiency becomes more important).  

I guess I didn't understand your proposal; I'm not
sure I do now.  Are you suggesting that we only inform
the ANN of changes to the tablaeu of card?  This is a
new idea; maybe it has merit.  I can't see right away
what the results would be.  It certainly would greatly
reduce the number of input signals.  We could start
with a fixed or random first move, and then we tell
the player what is different.  It seems like we would
be increasing the memory burden, but maybe this would
work.  

Do I understand you correctly now, that the idea is to
tell the ANN all the changes that occur, instead of
the current state of the table?
